Package edu.monash.fit2099.engine.positions

Class Location

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.positions.Location
All Implemented Interfaces:
Printable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConwayLocation
public class Location extends Object implements Printable
Class representing a location in the game map. This includes keeping track of exits, character representation, terrain type, and other game data.

  • Constructor Details

    • Location

      public Location​(GameMap map, int x, int y)
      Constructor. Locations know which map they are part of, and where.
      Parameters:
      map - the map that contains this location
      x - x coordinate of this location within the map
      y - y coordinate of this location within the map

  • Method Details

      Returns:
      the map that contains this Location

      Accessor for the y coordinate.
      Returns:
      the y coordinate

    • getItems

      public List<Item> getItems()
      Returns a list of items at this location. This list uses Collections.unmodifiableList() to prevent privacy leaks.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of items at this location

    • addItem

      public void addItem​(Item item)
      Add an item to this location.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem​(Item item)
      Remove an item from this location, if it is here.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to remove

      Set the Ground type at the given Location
      Parameters:
      ground - Ground type to set

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Called once per turn, so that Locations can experience the passage time. If that's important to them.

    • containsAnActor

      public boolean containsAnActor()
      Accessor to determine whether there is an Actor at this location.
      Returns:
      true if and only if there is an Actor at this location.

    • getActor

      public Actor getActor()
      Accessor to retrieve the Actor at this location.
      Returns:
      the Actor at this location, if there is one

    • addActor

      public void addActor​(Actor actor)
      Add an Actor to the Location. This is really only here for consistency for the Location API.
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor to add

    • getMoveAction

      public MoveActorAction getMoveAction​(Actor actor, String direction, String hotKey)
      Returns a MoveActorAction that will move actor to location if the terrain type allows.
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor to move
      direction - the direction of the destination from actor
      hotKey - the character that will trigger the movement command
      Returns:
      a MoveActorAction that allows actor to move to location if allowed; otherwise null

    • canActorEnter

      public boolean canActorEnter​(Actor actor)
      Returns true if an Actor can enter this location. Actors can enter a location if the terrain is passable and there isn't an Actor there already. Game rule. One actor per location.
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor who might be moving
      Returns:
      true if the Actor can enter this location

    • getDisplayChar

      public char getDisplayChar()
      Returns the character to display for this location. If there is an Actor here, they are drawn. If there is no Actor, then any items present are drawn. If there is no Actor and no item, then the ground symbol is drawn.
      Specified by:
      getDisplayChar in interface Printable
      Returns:
      the symbol to draw for this location

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Compare two Locations for equality.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object (presumably a Location) to compare
      Returns:
      true if obj is a reference to the current Location

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Computes a hash for the current Location.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash

    • getExits

      public List<Exit> getExits()
      Returns an unmodifiable list of exits.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of exits

    • addExit

      public void addExit​(Exit exit)
      Add an exit to this Location. This method is used in GameMap to initialize the Location's exits.
      Parameters:
      exit - the exit to add

    • removeExit

      public void removeExit​(Exit exit)
      Remove an exit from this Location. This method is used in GameMap to initialize the Location's exits.
      Parameters:
      exit - the exit to remove
